title: 112_hr4969
content: The curr_chunk is a section header titled "SHORT TITLE; DEFINITIONS." The Act is titled the "California Coastal National Monument Expansion Act of 2012" and defines key terms such as Monument, Secretary, Map, and Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands. The Act is titled the "California Coastal National Monument Expansion Act of 2012" and defines key terms such as Monument, Secretary, Map, and Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands. SEC. 2. FINDINGS; PURPOSE. The Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands contain significant natural resources, including wildlife habitat, wetlands, and sand dunes that should be preserved. The coastal ecosystems support diverse marine life and tell an important story about California's coastal history. The Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands have a rich history with Indian tribes and are associated with adjacent lands for future generations. It represents a successful partnership for management among various entities. Permanent protection of these lands will bring economic benefits. The Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands have broad public support and would be a significant addition to the California Coastal National Monument. Statutory protection is needed to preserve its historic, cultural, and natural heritage for the benefit of present and future generations. The purpose of this Act is to protect and enhance the unique values of the Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands. The Act aims to protect and enhance the scientific, educational, scenic, and recreational values of the Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands, while allowing certain activities to continue. Expansion of California Coastal National Monument. The California Coastal National Monument boundary is expanded to include Federal land managed under Presidential Proclamation 7264. The Secretary will file a map and boundary description with Congress, which will have the same force and effect as if included in the Act. The map and boundary description for the California Coastal National Monument will be available for public inspection to correct any minor errors. SEC. 4. ADMINISTRATION. The Secretary will manage the lands as part of the California Coastal National Monument. A management plan amendment must be finalized within 2 years for long-term protection. Motorized vehicles are restricted to designated roads and trails. The Secretary has the authority to acquire non-Federal land. The Secretary may acquire non-Federal land adjacent to the Monument through exchange, donation, or purchase. Acquired lands will be added to and managed as part of the Monument. Overflights, including low-level ones, are not restricted over the Monument. The expansion of the Monument does not restrict new special use airspace units or military flight training routes. It also does not affect low-level overflights above the adjacent marine sanctuary. The act does not impact Homeland Security law enforcement authorities or Native American rights. There will be no buffer zones created around the Monument. The Monument expansion does not restrict new special use airspace units or military flight training routes. It also does not affect low-level overflights above the adjacent marine sanctuary. The Secretary will manage the Monument as part of the National Landscape Conservation System.
